messages.title: Dear Voter,
messages.content: I got into politics to make things better for local people. I hope you agree the SNP has a good record, working hard to deliver for our community.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The SNP promises to invest in new jobs and the economy to ensure no more cuts.
The SNP intends to protect Scotland's NHS and keep it in public hands.
The SNP pledges over 300 new council houses built, new and refurbished schools, and free school meals for P1 to P3 children.
The SNP plans to make Westminster keep its promises to Scotland and play a constructive role at Westminster.
Increase the Minimum Wage by £2 to £8.70/hour by 2020.
Uplift Pensions UP 2.5%, keeping pace with inflation or wages.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Keep the Tories OUT of government.

issues.economy: INVEST in new jobs & the economy. NO MORE CUTS.
issues.education: over 300 new council houses built > new and refurbished schools > every £53million college on the way
issues.governance: Make Westminster keep its promises to Scotland. Play a constructive role at Westminster.
issues.health: > 2,315 more nurses and midwives in our NHS under the SNP
issues.socialWelfare: Childcare and public services, not £100billion on new bombs.

leaflet.personalStatement: I got into politics to make things better for local people.

endorsements.endorser: ex Labour supporters now backing SNP
endorsements.endorsement: As someone who worked for Cathy Jamieson for years, I am disenchanted with the direction of the political parties. However, I joined no longer exists and I do not think it knows what it stands for anymore. I joined the SNP because I know they will stand Stronger for Scotland and that is why I will be voting for Alan Brown.

images.caption: Alan Brown with First Minister, Nicola Sturgeon.
Group of people supporting SNP with signs.
